Dark energy was never proven to exist. 
It was made up to explain why the universe is expanding.
The universe WAS expanding in the past, that's why the farther we look in space the faster objects are expanding. The farther you look in space the farther back in TIME you are looking.
In other words it's an optical illusion,
We all agree that 14.7 billion years ago the universe was tiny and exploded, so when astronomers see galaxies expanding at 13.5 lightyears, hmm why is that???

If that was the case the their would be no elliptical galaxies in the universe due to the fact that they are formed from galaxy collisions, and we are on a collision course with andromeda. That would be impossible if all galaxies were expanding away from one another.  

Did you know that we can see our own galaxy in space, because when you 13.5 billion lightyears away you are lookin 13.5 billion years ago at the infant universe so our galaxy has to be there.

I'm not sure, and I haven't searched for the answer but this is what I think:
As mass in the center of a/the galaxy increases other masses like suns, planets and atoms get pulled on harder. This brings them out of their path a little thus making their path shorter. But this also increases their speed which brings them in about the same state they were in before. Any stars and planets that couldn't resist it have been sucked up in the black hole already and are what make up the black hole.

When you look at distance object in space you are seeing them as they were when they emitted there light, so if you see a star that's 5 lightyears away you are seeing that star as it was 5 years ago. Because stars have enough momentum to resist the gravitational force of black holes. It's the same reason that the earth does not fall into the sun, for example. Since the earth is revolving around the sun, it can resist its gravitational force. Gravity can also balance itself out. If the earth were to come closer to the sun, it would speed up. If it drifts away from the sun, it would slow down.
